name: Ocean Within - A Yoga Gathering with Chanchal
Circular Rhythms - A Soulful Hoop Flow Experience by Gowri Murthy
Mushroom Cultivation 101 (Offline)  - Introduction to Mushroom Cultivation: The Art of Working with Fungi
Unlocking Flow: Movement, Mind and Martial Arts - An introduction to entering the flow state
description: This workshop offers a hands-on introduction to entering the flow state—a mental and physical state where individuals experience deep focus, alignment, and effortless engagement. By integrating mental and physical effort, participants will explore how to achieve a sense of oneness, calm, and peak performance. We're mixing Brazilian martial arts, spinning hoops, and neuroscience of flow to help you tap into that elusive creative sweet spot, where your best work happens effortlessly.

name: Luru: Telling Stories - “Listen, and you will realize that we are made not from cells or from atoms. We are made from stories.”
Vasu Dixit Collective Live
Morning Flow: A Monsoon Pilates Session - Pilates with Gayathri
description: Gayatri Shetty is a contemporary dancer, choreographer, and performer based in Bangalore. Her work explores fragility, repetition, and presence through task-based performance and improvisation. She trained at Attakalari, Gibney Dance NYC, Gaga Lab Tel Aviv, and also studied Pilates instruction with KINNECTED Piltes while in New York. She has performed at Serendipity Arts Festival, PECDA, March Dance, and more, and is a member of Citizens for Stage Co-Lab.  Gayatri is currently developing her solo choreographic voice through works that investigate care, failure and resiliance.

name: Urban Foraging: Edition 14- Nuvedo - Led by INDIAN TOADSTOOL-  A Wizard of the Woods
Penciljam Bengaluru at Sabha - The Monsoon Edit
A Sonic Experience with Xenkat - Electronica meets tradition
description: Immerse yourselves in a lush sonic landscape. Sidd, under his moniker Xenkat, works with reviving ancient, forgotten instruments. His performance blends together electronica, Carnatic style guitars, and tribal instruments such as the didgeridoo, mouth harp and asalato. Come join us for a groovy live looping act!

name: Teesta Troupers Live @ Sabha X Luru Monsoon Edit
Pasha Bhai Live @ Sabha X Luru Monsoon Edit - By Clan Bokka Phod
"Sweet As" - An uplifting coming-of-age Australian movie - An Invitation from The Australian Consulate-General, Bengaluru
New Horizon Weftscapes: A Jamdani Indigo Showcase   - A Showcase of Indian Kimonos by Bappaditya Biswas (Bai Lou)
description: Explore an evocative showcase of Indigo-dyed Jamdani kimonos by acclaimed textile artist and social entrepreneur Bappaditya Biswas. Known for revitalising Bengal's handloom traditions through innovative materials and storytelling, Biswas presents a contemporary interpretation of Jamdani that challenges boundaries—of craft, geography, and garment. Alongside the exhibition, join us for an artist talk on July 26,  (RSVP separately)  where he shares insights into his process, his use of organic indigo, and the evolving identity of handloom weaving in India. About Bappaditya Biswas:  Bappaditya Biswas is a leading Indian textile artist and social entrepreneur, renowned for his innovative contributions to Bengal handloom weaving. He co-founded the brand Bai Lou and the iconic Kolkata store Byloom, both of which merge traditional craftsmanship with contemporary aesthetics. Biswas has traveled globally to study dyeing and weaving traditions, and one of his weaves has been honored with the UNESCO Seal of Excellence. The brand's work has been showcased in various exhibitions, including "The Chintz Story" at Gallery Threshold in Delhi, which highlighted Biswas's remarkable body of work

name: New Horizon Weftscapes: In Conversation with Madhu Nataraj & Bappaditya Biswas - A part of an exhibition of Indigo-dyed Jamdani kimonos
description: What do textiles and choreography have in common? Join acclaimed choreographer and arts entrepreneur Madhu Nataraj (Director, Naatya Institute of Kathak & Choreography) and celebrated textile artist Bappaditya Biswas for a rich, interdisciplinary conversation on tradition, innovation, and the body in motion—whether through fabric or dance. This dialogue accompanies Weftscapes, an exhibition of Indigo-dyed Jamdani kimonos by Bappaditya Biswas, on view at Sabha from July 24–27. Free and open to the public. About Bappaditya Biswas:  Bappaditya Biswas is a leading Indian textile artist and social entrepreneur, renowned for his innovative contributions to Bengal handloom weaving. He co-founded the brand Bai Lou and the iconic Kolkata store Byloom, both of which merge traditional craftsmanship with contemporary aesthetics. Biswas has traveled globally to study dyeing and weaving traditions, and one of his weaves has been honored with the UNESCO Seal of Excellence. The brand's work has been showcased in various exhibitions, including "The Chintz Story" at Gallery Threshold in Delhi, which highlighted Biswas's remarkable body of work.
